citation.title: Experience with Social Distancing Early in the COVID-19 Pandemic in the United States: Implications for Public Health Messaging

blogs.title: Why people didn’t social distance
blogs.summary: The Stanford-led study found the most common reasons people did not follow social distancing recommendations were work requirements, mental and physical health concerns and beliefs that other precautions were enough.

author.name: Stanford News Headlines
author.description: Latest  news headlines from Stanford University.

news.title: Work and a desire to exercise, socialize are why people didn't social distance, researchers find
news.summary: Maintaining social distance has been crucial in slowing the spread of novel coronavirus infections (COVID-19), yet some people did not follow early recommendations to limit physical contact with others.

news.title: Work and a desire to exercise, socialize are why people didnt social distance, Stanford researchers find
news.summary: The Stanford-led study found the most common reasons people did not follow social distancing recommendations were work requirements, mental and physical health concerns and beliefs that other precautions were enough.

news.title: Stanford University: Majority of young people ignored social distancing orders, new survey suggests
news.summary: We’ve all heard it incessantly for the past month amid the coronavirus outbreak: “maintain social distancing.” But despite shutting down businesses, working from home and traveling less, people still went out in droves to go on jogs and meet friends…

news.title: Stanford University: Majority of young people ignored social distancing orders, new survey suggests
news.summary: Governor Newsom: California sees single-day high in COVID-19 deaths We’ve all heard it incessantly for the past month amid the coronavirus outbreak: “maintain social distancing.” But despite shutting down businesses, working from home and traveling…

news.title: Stanford Study: Young Adults Flout Social Distancing Rules
news.summary: STANFORD, CA — Until there’s a vaccine or a cure for the new coronavirus, adherence to social distancing rules is our only hope of surviving this pandemic.

news.title: Work and a desire to exercise, socialize are why people didn’t social distance, researchers find. – Infosurhoy
news.summary: Maintaining social distance has been crucial in slowing the spread of novel coronavirus infections (COVID-19), yet some people did not follow early recommendations to limit physical contact with others.

news.title: Why some people were slow to social distance - Futurity
news.summary: A new study reveals reasons why people may not have followed early recommendations to limit physical contact with others.

news.title: Why Some People Don't Social Distance
news.summary: Home News Why Some People Don’t Social Distance Why are some people failing to comply with social distancing recommendations in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic? A team of researchers at Stanford University in California found that work…

news.title: Young adults are driving the surge in coronavirus cases in Arizona, Florida, and Texas, officials say. Patients' median ages are dropping.

news.title: ¿Puede debilitarse la COVID-19?
news.summary: Varios expertos, principalmente en Italia y marginalmente en España, han compartido opiniones que defienden que el SARS-CoV-2 podría estar volviéndose menos virulento.

news.title: ¿Puede debilitarse la COVID-19?
news.summary: No se trata de un descenso en el número de casos, sino que los casos de los brotes activos serían más leves Varios expertos, principalmente en Italia y marginalmente en España, han compartido opiniones que defienden que el SARS-CoV-2 podría estar…

news.title: ¿Puede el virus de la Covid-19 estar debilitándose?
news.summary: Se refieren no a un descenso de casos, sino al hecho de que los casos de los brotes actualmente activos serían más leves que los registrados en los momentos más intensos de la pandemia Varios expertos, principalmente en Italia, aunque también en Españ…
